newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel up, Mercury off.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel up, Mercury off.

text.p: Intel Corp's announcement that it lowered first quarter prices on some microprocessor lines while preserving prices on its higher-end Pentium Pro chips attracted investors to the stock early Thursday.
Preceding the U.S. market open, Intel rose 2-1/4 to 157 in heavy third market trade.
Analysts said the price cuts were less than expected and a sign that demand remains strong for Intel microprocessors.
Elsewhere, U.S. traders said Mercury Finance Co traded down to 4-1/4 from 14-7/8 overseas, while a New York Stock Exchange trading halt remained in effect.

Mercury announced yesterday that accounting irregularities caused the company to overstate earnings by $90 million over four years, and that the company's chief financial officer James Doyle apparently had disappeared.

Traders said they expect Vivus Inc to trade lower at the market open after it said unexpectedly strong demand for its MUSE compound to treat erectile dysfunction has caused a temporary shortage of supply.
Before the open, Vivus was quoted at 48-1/2 bid, 48-5/8 ask, under Wednesday's Nasdaq close of 49.

Also active before the open were: Microsoft, up 1-1/4 to 98-1/2, 3Com Corp rose to 64 from 62-3/4, Madge Networks climbed one to 16-1/8, Sync Research rose to 16-1/2 from 14-1/4 and Sodak Gaming added 1-1/4 to 18.
Encad Inc was indicated to rise after it said this morning it expects to earn $0.35 per share in the fourth quarter, a 129 percent increase from the year-ago period.
Before the open, the shares were quoted at 30-3/4 bid, 30-1/4 ask, above the 28-3/4 last Nasdaq trade Wednesday.
